main event: Bright object recovered in South Africa
interesting points: The object was identified as a fragment of the Atlas rocket that launched John Glenn into orbit on February 20, 1962.
The fragment was recovered near Aliwal North in the Cape Province of South Africa on February 21, 1962.
The fragment was presented to the South African government in an informal ceremony by the U.S. Ambassador Joseph C. Satterthwaite.
The remaining fragments of the booster rocket were given to the United States by the South African government.
The South African government assured that suitable arrangements would be made to exhibit the fragment to the public, with the initial exhibition at the Pretoria-Transvaal Show.
result: Identified as a fragment of the Atlas rocket
